articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Graves in Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Graves in Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were placed before the graves of ardent patriots Kim Po Hyon and Ri Po Ik and those of Kim Hyong Jik, outstanding leader of the Korean anti-Japanese national liberation movement, and Kang Pan Sok, distinguished leader of the Korean women's movement, on Sunday, the Harvest Moon Day.
					 Seen before their graves in Mangyongdae were wreaths from Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Ryong Hae and other senior party, state and army officials, officials of party and power bodies, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and other people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Placed before the graves were wreaths in the name of the WPK Central Committee and the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 Then the wreaths in the name of working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions and educational, media institutions as well as party and power bodies and farms in Pyongyang, etc. were laid.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the graves.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Martyrs Cemeteries on Harvest Moon Day
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Martyrs Cemeteries on Harvest Moon Day
						
 Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery on Sunday, the Harvest Moon Day.
					 Seen on the wreath-laying stands of the cemeteries were wreaths sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were Choe Yong Rim and other senior party, state and army officials, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF) and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Wreaths were laid on the wreath-laying stands in the name of the Central Committee of the WPK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 Also laid there were wreaths in the name of working people's organisations, ministries and national institutions, units of the KPA and the KPISF, educational, public health and media institutions, party and power organs, enterprises and farms here, etc.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the martyrs.
					
					 On this day wreaths and bouquets were laid before the statues and cemeteries of martyrs, the Monuments to the Fallen Fighters of the Korean People's Army and their cemeteries in various parts of the DPRK.

articles.title: Sister Relations Established between Cities in DPRK and Russia
articles.content:
Sister Relations Established between Cities in DPRK and Russia 
						
 Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- An agreement on establishing sister relations between Haeju City of the DPRK and Ulan-Ude City, Republic of Buryatia of Russia was signed in Haeju City, South Hwanghae Province on Sunday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Ri Sung Chon, chairman of the Haeju City People's Committee, and officials concerned and from the Russian side the members of the delegation of the Ulan-Ude City, Russia, headed by Mayor Gennadi Aidayev.

articles.title: Minju Joson Assails Outbursts of S. Korean Minister of Unification
articles.content:
Minju Joson Assails Outbursts of S. Korean Minister of Unification
						
 Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- At a meet with foreign press on September 24 Ryu U Ik, south Korean puppet minister of Unification, made remarks groundlessly finding fault with the social system in the DPRK, talking about "essential limitation" and the like. He went the lengths of asserting "the north was to blame for the freeze of the inter-Korean relations."
					 Minju Joson Sunday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					What Ryu uttered is nothing but a shriek made by him, taken aback by the might of the single-minded unity of the whole party and army and all people around their supreme leader.
					
					 There is reason why Ryu is making such desperate efforts to shore up the Lee group's "policy toward the north", defaming the social system in the DPRK this or that way.
					
					The issue of the inter-Korean relations and the issue of implementing the north-south joint declarations, in particular, have become focal points in the south Korean political circles with the "presidential" election close at hand.  Broad strata of people are now urging the "presidential" candidates from the ruling and opposition parties and an independent candidate not to follow in the footsteps of traitor Lee Myung Bak who brought the inter-Korean relations to a collapse but make a switchover in the present "policy toward the north", a policy of confrontation with compatriots in the north. It is against this backdrop that the puppet Ministry of Unification and its Chief Ryu U Ik, in particular, are hard hit by the public. Ryu is busy making outcries in a bid to get rid of this tight corner. But his rigmaroles only brought his true colors as a confrontation maniac into bolder relief. The recent reckless remarks made by Ryu as a yes man of Lee only added to the unpardonable c
					
					 rimes he has committed against the nation.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will also force Ryu to pay dearly for what he has done when punishing the Lee group of traitors by force of arms.
					
					 Ryu would be well advised to behave himself, bearing in mind that out of the mouth comes evil.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper on "Choenan" Warship's Possible Sinking by Mine Explosion
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper on "Cheonan" Warship's Possible Sinking by Mine Explosion
 Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- Facts showing the possibility of "Cheonan" warship's sinking by a mine are being disclosed one after another, according to the south Korean newspaper Hangyore on September 26.
					 The paper said that the joint investigation team excluded the possibility of mine explosion in its final report on the "Cheonan" ship's sinking case in 2010.
					
					 But it was recently disclosed by a person related to the operation of planting sea mines in the waters off Paekryong Islet that mines controlled ashore, a revised version of the U.S. anti-submarine bomb, exploded at least three or four times at the time of their laying in 1979 and right after that.
					
					 Inhabitants on Paekryong Islet said they saw mines in the sea and found the signs of their explosion, the paper said, adding it has become clear that there still remain lots of mines in the waters around the islet.
					
					 It is experts' view that the explosion of the mines are likely even after the lapse of over three decades, the paper stressed, adding:
					
					 The evidence refuting the conclusion of the joint investigation team actively supports the argument of "Cheonan's" possible sinking by a mine.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Exploits Lauded in Colombia and Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Exploits Lauded in Colombia and Brazil
						
 Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in Colombia and Brazil on Sept. 15 and 21 to commemorate the 63rd anniversary of passing of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 Present at the seminars were personages of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea "Kanggye" of Colombia and the Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea and other people in those countries.
					
					 Jairo Gonzalez Trujillo, president of the Colombian group, and other speakers praised Kim Jong Suk, a woman commander of Mt. Paektu, for firmly protecting President Kim Il Sung politically and ideologically and at the risk of her life in the periods of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle and the building of a new country.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk's life was a brilliant one of a great revolutionary who devoted her everything to the country and its people, he said, adding her exploits would shine forever along with the eternally prospering socialist Songun Korea which was built and developed by Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and which the dear respected Kim Jong Un is leading.
					
					 Gabriel Gonsalves Martinez, general secretary of the Brazilian center, and other speakers spoke highly of the life of Kim Jong Suk who devotedly protected the leader and ardently loved the country and its people.
					
					 They stressed her desire which was translated into a reality in the DPRK under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il would come into fuller bloom under the guidance of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Nigerian Organization Praises Kim Jong Il's Feats
articles.content:
Nigerian Organization Praises Kim Jong Il's Feats
						
 Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted articles under various titles on its website on Sept. 20 and 21 to celebrate the 67th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 Under the title of "The Workers' Party of Korea Called Mother Party", an article said the Korean people are pleased to call the WPK a mother party, adding it is thanks to the guidance of leader Kim Jong Il that the WPK now enjoys undisputed support and trust from the people.
					
					 The article carried anecdotes about Kim Jong Il who said only when a party cadre is kind-hearted, people would like to meet him and humanity and kindness are the personality to be possessed by party officials, while teaching what traits the party officials should have.
					
					 An article titled "Legacy of leader Kim Jong Il" said Kim Jong Il glorified the Juche idea and the Songun idea as a great guiding idea in the era of independence and developed the WPK into an invincible guiding force and the DPRK into an invulnerable bulwark of socialism and the Korean People's Army into matchless revolutionary forces.
					
					 The undying feats Kim Jong Il performed all his life will remain shining as the most valuable legacy that guarantees the triumph of the cause of socialism in the DPRK and the cause of human independence.
					
					 An article titled "Hot Wind of Kim Jong Un" said the attention of the international community is focused on the dear respected Kim Jong Un and boundless respect for him is growing strong among the progressive mankind in our planet.

articles.title: Brazilian Organization Praises DPRK as Country for People
articles.content:
Brazilian Organization Praises DPRK as Country for People
						
 Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea posted an article titled "Socialist Korea, Country for People" with photos on revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung on its internet homepage on Sept. 21 on the occasion of the 64th birthday of the DPRK.
					 The article said:
					
					 The DPRK is a country for the people both in name and reality.
					
					 The line and all policies in the DPRK are shaped in reflection of the people's desire and wishes and implemented in their interests.
					
					 When the people's will and wishes are comprehensively reflected and systemized, they are sure to become a line and policies. This was a constant view of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The article said that Kim Il Sung worked out policies in reflection of the people's will and wishes even before proclaiming the founding of the DPRK in September of 1948 and thoroughly implemented them. It gave a detailed account of the law on the agrarian reform, the law on sex equality, the labor law and the law on nationalization of major industries.
					
					 The more than six decade-long history of the DPRK clearly proved that it is the genuine regime for the people, the article said, adding Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il devoted their all to realizing the people's centuries-old desire.
					
					 The DPRK is now bringing about a decisive turn in the efforts to improve the people's standard of living, it said, stressing the eye-opening events taking place in the DPRK are the fruition of the love shown by the great Generalissimos and the dear respected Kim Jong Un for the people through their patriotic devotion.
					
					 The people's country, the DPRK will prosper forever thanks to the undisputed support and trust of the people, the article emphasized.
					
					 The homepage edited photos showing the true picture of Korean-style socialism.

articles.title: Swiss Organizations Blast U.S. Moves for Invading DPRK
articles.content:
Swiss Organizations Blast U.S. Moves for Invading DPRK 
						
 Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on Sep. 23 condemning the U.S. for its move to build a new radar base under the pretext of coping with "threat of missile attack from the DPRK".
					 Assailing this move of the U.S. the statement said: The above-said move is another act of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 It is a dangerous action straining the situation in the Asia-Pacific region and sparking off an arms race.
					
					 The U.S. has tried to establish its system of military domination in various parts of the world, while staging a stereotyped psychological warfare for several decades under the pretext of coping with missile attack of potential enemies.
					
					 The U.S. secretary of Defense's recent open declaration that the new radar base is not targeted against China but against the DPRK more clearly reveals the hypocrisy of the U.S. claim that it has no hostile intent to the DPRK.
					
					 It is quite natural for the DPRK to further bolster up its nuclear deterrent for self-defence under the situation that the U.S. is steadily beefing up its military capability against the DPRK. 
					
					 The statement vehemently condemned the U.S. move to build a new radar base in Japan.
					
					 It extended solidarity to the DPRK in its resolute struggle against the U.S. moves for aggression.
